rComments: I am 2 years graduated but Professor Urban was the best I had during my undergrad studies.   He is hard, make no mistake. But he is incredibly fair and always willing to be a resource. I took 2 of his classes and received A's in both. I took drafts of my essays to him, etc.   Don't skip reading and definitely don't skip class. Very worth it.

Michael Urban is a horrible professor. His lectures are boring and he hardly even makes sense. If you have no prior knowledge of Eurasian Politics you will be far behind. He expects you to know Russian history from the beginning. Don't take this class unless you want to suffer and most likely fail.

Tough class because the concepts are foreign, and there is a lot of reading. However, Urban is a really good teacher, his lectures are supported by his personal accounts. His lectures are their to clarify the reading so I strongly suggest to go to everyone. Don't slack on the readings because they are very essential.

Professor urban can be intimidating because he is so tall. However, he is a nice guy and an excellent professor. Readings were huge 300 page books every week but the subject revolution was amazingly fascinating. It was excellent being in this man's class and I really enjoyed it.

AMAZING professor. Lecture style is dry, but Urban can back up almost every theory or concept with really interesting stories about the decades he's spent in Russia. Tough course and reading assignments are literally unmanageable, but take notes on everything he says in lecture and you'll be fine. One of the best classes I've taken at UCSC.

While admittedly Urban's lectures can be vague and key points difficult to distinguish, this is so far my FAVORITE course I have taken, and I absolutely love Urban. Readings can be dense, but if you attend every lecture and take careful notes there is a lot of forgiveness. Class is challenging, but rewarding. Go to office hours for clarity. LOVED!!

Horrible lecturer. Spends most of the time telling irrelevant stories that have nothing to do with the subject matter. Also, the readings are long and ridiculously boring. The tests cover up to 600+ pages of reading with no study guide, and then the test will have fill-ins asking for random facts. Teacher is unyielding and won't curve either.

Just an overall Badass, his stories make the class and his experiences living in the Soviet Union make the class way more exciting. reading assignments are insane but if you keep up he lectures on the reading. He has great TA's to make up for that fact he doesnt give alot of one on one time to his students. two thumbs up tho, if you can take him!

Urban is bad-ass.  Awesome guy.  Really worth listening to.  Some readings are a bit dry, but others are great.  He tells Russian jokes to illustrate anthropological/political points.  Gotta love that.

Urban is the best professor I had in this school! I made the mistake of not taking one of his classes this quarter and I won't make that mistake again!! I wish he taught more classes so I wouldn't have to take classes with other lecturers.. Take lots of notes and enjoy the class!

Urban is very knowledgeable with tons of first hand experience in Russia. His class was very difficult, however, and required a huge amount of reading  that was also very dense. I would recommend learning EVERYTHING covered in the class (lectures, reading etc.) for the midterm. That is the only way you'll get an A. Learn every single fact possible.

fantastic teacher. extremely interesting, with real life experience to contribute. very humorous as well. attendence is essential and you have to do the reading, but not too much and all his tests are very fair. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. urban is a ****ing g.
Ridiculous amounts of reading, but extremely engaging lectures and a very interesting class altogether. Know personally many of the people discussed in lecture. Hard but worth it.

DO NOT TAKE URBAN!  First, he is unable to think and speak logically.  If you are intelligent, you will find his neanderthal utterances a total waste of time.  Secondly, he has no intellectual integrity and is very biased - don't dare to question his beliefs!  Lastly, he literally whispers in class.  IF YOU CARE ABOUT LEARNING, DON'T TAKE HIM!

I found him boring, tended to talk on about stuff that seemed off topic, LOTS of reading that was dull.  despite that some friends loved him, i found him knowledgable but not great at conveying things to the class in intersting ways, found myself gradually ditching as quarter went on, one of the harder class but more cause its boring than difficult

Urban is a good story teller. The only problem is figuring out which of his stories are relevant to the class and which ones he just tells for fun. There was a bunch of really hard readings and his lectures rambled and made little sense. You either love him or hated him. My advice: stay away.

He knew his stuff, but it was hard to distinguish the key points from everything else. LOTS of reading; hard grader. He seemed to know his info on a firsthand basis, but argued with most alternative ideas and claimed they were wrong. Midterm: know your KEY TERMS! Final was easy. Make sure you have a creative thesis for term paper, which is long.
Professor Urban is a nice guy. He is vague at times which makes it very difficult to comprehend some lectures and course material.  Be prepared to dedicate yourself to his class.

There was a lot of reading required. I basically didn't know where I stood by the end of the final, but I passed. As long as you do the reading and have an idea of what's going on you'll do good. This was however an interesting class and his insight to the subject was obvious.

He is interesting, but he jumps from topic to topic. It is hard to tell what is important, what to write in your notes, and what you should simply listen to. He is great one on one, but on the whole his lectures or draining and or confusing.

Engaging lectures, with lots of interesting anecdotes and analogies.  Sit in the front though, because he speaks quietly.  A lot of reading, but he emphasizes the most important ones and the tests aren't too hard.  He can seem a little indimidating, but he is incredibly approachable, knowledgeable, and helpful.

He was a really good professor. KNew so much about the world of the ex-soviet union. Tests were very fair and if you study the things he goes over in class you can definately get an A. Lots of cool stories about wars in Russia and such.

He jumps around a lot and speaks quietly so it's hard to follow his lectures, but he tells great stories and is careful not to inject his opinions into the course material. He refuses to give a review for exams so you have to study EVERYTHING in order to do well. Also, he won't curve grades, even if half the classs fails. He's a nice guy though.

His lower division class was one of hte best I took.  As I developed my own perspective however, I grew frustrtated with him as he seemed semi-dogmatic at times.  Once I confronted him, I was on his bad side and never recovered.

very interesting, tells the craziest stories about being in russian revolutions. i liked his class a lot. good amount of reading, but if you study the right stuff you can do well in his class. i got an A+ without doing all the reading.
His lectures are boring, and he is very soft spoken, and jumps around in his lecture alot.

Great Class. He was very clear and made the lectures very interesting. The topics he covered were new and fascinating and overall, he made the class. The tests were fair, the reading was extensive, but overall, I'd definitely reccomend it. Especially over a Ronnie Lipshutz class (SHUDDER).
This guy is genuine, very confident in his knowledge, reasoning, and communication to students.  One of the best teacher's I've ever had.
Very interesting class and teacher. Beware of the grading oppurtunities because they are few and far between, so do your best to do well in the class. Go to his office hours, they help.

Very engaging instructor. He really knows his stuff and communicates it well. I found the required reading to be reasonable for an upper division class. He is also available outside of class, which is something worth taking advantage of. In all, I highly recommend taking a class with Professor Urban
He is an awesome person. He is great to visit with for office hours and is very helpful. His anecdotes are awesome and he is extremely knowledgable. He is a great professor.
An excellent teacher.  Makes the topic very clear and interesting.  LOTS of reading, but it's worthwhile.

This class is not easy for two reasons.  First, there is a huge amount of reading, and second Urban is a great storyteller, but a little difficult to summarize while taking notes.  Still,it is worth it- the material is interesting and Urban is a nice guy.

Lots of reading and not an easy gen ed. He knew a ton about the subject and really increased my interest in russia. he is one of the best teachers i have ever had, but he is not an easy grader at all.

His Russian Poli class is very interesting. I LEARNED SO much. Very knowelegable man--YOU MUST READ. bad thing- massive amounts of reading to the point where he must think you have no other classes besides his. some readings intriguing and some are dense

Very interesting class, your interest in Russia grows exponentially as the class goes on, so much first-hand knowledge it is rediculous. a teacher gains a lot of credibility when instead of saying "i read a paper about yeltsin" they say, "i
Urban rocks!!  You will learn a lot and be entertained with great Russian jokes!  He will really change your perspective on politics and the world!  One of the best politics professors at UCSC!

Michael Urban is our campus' leading expert on Russian and Eastern European Politics.  However, Poli 140B -- theoretically on Post-Communist Eastern Europe and Russia -- was more focused on the system as it existed before the fall of the Berlin Wall.
Specialist in Russian Politics, Communism and Post-Communism in Eastern/Central Europe. Engaging. Brilliant. Difficult, but you learn a ton. In the top three of professors I've had in college.
